Authors: Maharani A., Hosen C., Lius W.F., Dharmawan D.
Title: Relationships between rewards, knowledge sharing, and creativity and its effect on organizational performance
Affiliations: Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maharani, A., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hosen, C., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lius, W.F., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dharmawan, D., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to see the increased influence generated by rewards, knowledge sharing and creativity on organizational performance. Organizational performance, centers on the commitment of each representative within the company, to work in agreement with existing values in arrange to realize company objectives, In this study, creativity participates by mediating between existing variables. Another thing that may be considered as factor that determine organizational performance is knowledge sharing. Organizational performance contains a noteworthy impact on company advancement. This study uses quantitative approach, by using specific items that measure variables. The results of this study indicate that all variables measured, rewards, knowledge sharing and creativity (as mediation) affect organizational performance. © IAEME Publication Scopus Indexed
Author Keywords: Creativity; Knowledge; Organizational; Performance; Rewards; Sharing

Title: Millenials preferences on their savings and consumptions: Proposed framework
Affiliations: Business Management Program, Management Program, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maharani, A., Business Management Program, Management Program, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Millennial generation is considered as an interesting subject to be the target of research, especially seen from the habits of this generation in life. The purpose of this study is to see how the patterns of financial behavior among the millennials, seen from saving and consumption behavior. The conceptual approach used in this study refers to the concepts of age, preferences, and financial behavior. However, this study itself is a conceptual paper, this research proposed a model that in the future may uses an explanatory descriptive approach and data collection using quantitative methods. © IAEME Publication.
Author Keywords: Behavior; Consumption; Framework; Preferences; Proposed; Saving

Authors: Wulandari R., Maharani A., Young D., Winoto T.
Title: Training model for improving human resource performance and quality in a parking insurance company
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: International Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wulandari, R., International Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maharani, A., Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Young, D., International Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Winoto, T., International Business Management Program, Department of Management, BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to develop a model of training for one parking insurance company. This company was chosen as our object since they struggled with the human resources they employed. Training concept is used as a primary theoretical framework. This research used qualitative methods, through focus group discussion to collect data, using qualitative data analysis to interpret information. Based on the results of this research, the parking insurance company should develop training by implementing the original concepts of the training development phase, where the company must go through four stages of training development, which are assessment, design, implementation, and evaluation to develop a training program. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press
Funding Text 1: The authors wish to acknowledge and thank all IMHA 2018 committee members and UPM Pertanika journal team that help publish this article.

Title: Relationships between mother and son and its effect on effort of passing the baton
Source title: International Journal of Applied Business and Economic Research
Authors with affiliations: Maharani, A., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: In a search of sustainability, even a small business too will need to have a process of passing the baton, from elder generation to younger generation. This research, aimed to explore the dynamic of relationships that builds between mother and her childs, and to see its effect of effort of passing the baton of business. Approach of this research is case study, and explore the context between the presence of mother and her later generations, using the concept of family owned business. Results found from this research, husband plays an important role as strategic decision maker, trust is demonstrated by mother to her later generations in order to decide who is eligible to continue the business. © 2017 Serials Publications Pvt. Ltd.
Author Keywords: Mother; Passing the baton; Relationships; Son
